descr: "Representation of the content produced in a DICOM imaging study. A study comprises a set of series, each of which includes a set of Service-Object Pair Instances (SOP Instances - images or other data) acquired or produced in a common context.  A series is of only one modality (e.g. X-ray, CT, MR, ultrasound), but a study may have multiple series of different modalities."

fields.name: resourceType
fields.descr: "This is a ImagingStudy resource"

fields.name: uid
fields.descr: "Formal identifier for the study."

fields.name: accession
fields.descr: "Accession Number is an identifier related to some aspect of imaging workflow and data management. Usage may vary across different institutions.  See for instance [IHE Radiology Technical Framework Volume 1 Appendix A](http://www.ihe.net/uploadedFiles/Documents/Radiology/IHE_RAD_TF_Rev13.0_Vol1_FT_2014-07-30.pdf)."

fields.name: identifier
fields.descr: "Other identifiers for the study."

fields.name: availability
fields.descr: "Availability of study (online, offline, or nearline)."

fields.name: modalityList
fields.descr: "A list of all the Series.ImageModality values that are actual acquisition modalities, i.e. those in the DICOM Context Group 29 (value set OID 1.2.840.10008.6.1.19)."

fields.name: patient
fields.descr: "The patient imaged in the study."

fields.name: context
fields.descr: "The encounter or episode at which the request is initiated."

fields.name: started
fields.descr: "Date and time the study started."

fields.name: basedOn
fields.descr: "A list of the diagnostic requests that resulted in this imaging study being performed."

fields.name: referrer
fields.descr: "The requesting/referring physician."

fields.name: interpreter
fields.descr: "Who read the study and interpreted the images or other content."

fields.name: endpoint
fields.descr: "The network service providing access (e.g., query, view, or retrieval) for the study. See implementation notes for information about using DICOM endpoints. A study-level endpoint applies to each series in the study, unless overridden by a series-level endpoint with the same Endpoint.type."

fields.name: numberOfSeries
fields.descr: "Number of Series in the Study. This value given may be larger than the number of series elements this Resource contains due to resource availability, security, or other factors. This element should be present if any series elements are present."

fields.name: numberOfInstances
fields.descr: "Number of SOP Instances in Study. This value given may be larger than the number of instance elements this resource contains due to resource availability, security, or other factors. This element should be present if any instance elements are present."

fields.name: procedureReference
fields.descr: "A reference to the performed Procedure."

fields.name: procedureCode
fields.descr: "The code for the performed procedure type."

fields.name: reason
fields.descr: "Description of clinical condition indicating why the ImagingStudy was requested."

fields.name: description
fields.descr: "Institution-generated description or classification of the Study performed."

fields.name: series
fields.descr: "Each study has one or more series of images or other content."

fields.name: text
fields.descr:
"A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it \"clinically safe\" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: contained
fields.descr:
"These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: extension
fields.descr:
"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: modifierExtension
fields.descr:
"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: id
fields.descr:
"The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: meta
fields.descr:
"The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: implicitRules
fields.descr:
"A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content."

 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: language
fields.descr:
"The base language in which the resource is written."
